Question: What is Speedrun?
Answer: Speedrun is a recurring Solana Game Jam, a competition where developers have a limited time to create a game from scratch based on a given theme.

Question: When will Speedrun take place?
Answer: Solana Speedrun will take place from December 12th to December 17th.

Question: Where will Speedrun take place?
Answer: Speedrun is a virtual event - anybody can participate regardless of their location. Physical events might be set up by local communities. Join the Discord server to discover the closest physical venue and hack IRL with your local community.

Question: When will the Theme be revealed?
Answer: The theme will be revealed at the beginning of the competition and participants must create a game that incorporates the main Theme.

Question: What are the rules to submit my game?
Answer: You can decide to take part in the Fully On-chain or Solana-integrated track. Sponsored tracks are additional tracsk you can particiapate in to win any combination of prizez, on top of the main tracks. As long as you respect the requirement of a track, you can opt-in into it. As a general rule, your game must be playable - make sure you create a fun game first and foremost!

Question: Can I submit a game that I've already developed?
Answer: No, games must be created specifically for Speedrun and must follow the Theme.

Question: Can I use pre-existing code or assets?
Answer: Yes, you are allowed to use pre-existing code and assets, as long as they are open source or properly licensed. You are not allowed to submit an existing game and all the submission should respect the theme of the jam.

Question: Can I participate with multiple submissions?
Answer: If you are able to create more than one game you can submit all of them with multiple submissions, but each entry must be unique.

Question: What if my game isn't finished?
Answer: It doesn't matter as long as it is playable. Make sure to explore our resources before the Theme reveal to familiarize with the stack and complete your project before the deadline.

Question: Where can I find resources to prepare for the Game Jam?
